Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, as you have completed this book, the last of medical science, through the fulfillment of its end and due to its expositions, explanations, and declarations, it seems to me that you have fully grasped this treatise, which is a part of the most excellent surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, considered the most excellent art, is scorned in our region and time, as its science is greatly neglected, and its practice has almost disappeared; it is only occasionally that one finds small descriptions of it in the books of the Ancients, which have led to confusion and error, as the understanding of its principles is closed off, and its power and skill are diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I have found it necessary to revive that order of this treatise according to the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that the forms of cautery tools and other surgical instruments be included as an addition to the declaration and as a preparation for the work, which is required.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why our skillful physician lacks complete knowledge in this our time is because the art of medicine is complex and requires understanding the development of the members and their forms, as well as their connection and separation; it demands knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, and the names of each, and their extraction; and of the pulsating and static veins, and the places where they exit.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates says that the name is fitting, for in practice it is simple but mainly in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, it is evident that they are likely to make errors which will lead to men's deaths, as you have seen many people thus misinformed in this science gain knowledge only through experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Where you see a foolish doctor who has incurred a scrofulous abscess in the armpit of a woman and cut some arteries in her armpit so that much blood flows until the woman dies from it.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who put a stone from a man who had processed it in his bladder, and the stone was large, he came to him and extracted that stone with a piece of the vesica, so that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you had already called for help to extract it, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the illness, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who was paid handsomely by a duke from our land for surgery, and he took a black crack in the leg of a man who had a broken bone; because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture over the wound, with poultices and bandages tightly stretched, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then, according to his desires, loosen the bandages, rest for some days, and order us to loosen the ligament; and thus it is also done that the thing and the foot are healed and do not become infected.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have been called to loosen the ligament, and by doing so, you achieve calmness and thereby alleviate their pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is already confirmed in the member and it cannot be restrained, then the corruption will continue to spread throughout the member until the patient perishes from the illness.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there is another doctor who perforates a cancerous abscess, and it ulcerates for some days until the pus intensifies the malice of the illness towards its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes is because the sharp cautery is pure of melancholic humor, and then it does not cover that it will reach him entirely with a ferrule, but rather, it should be in the member which suffers that it be entirely removed.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation of the body should be carefully divided into two parts: one is in the operation associated with health, and the other is in the work which is dangerous to major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this throughout all parts of this book where operations are described that contain error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to remember these things and lay them down, so that the ignorant do not dare speak and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons of diligence and protection from God, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best means for the grace of God that lead to salvation and glorious success, set aside the terrible illnesses with difficult healing, and abandon your weapons of fear, so that weakness in your faith and in your name does not escape you: for more remains to your glory, both now and forever after in the memories of your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	They already cut open certain of their organs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad ailments with bad medicines, so that bad doctors do not become famous.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, starting with the first part of the first chapter.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is organized on the feet, in the forms of instruments and the tools of cautery, and everything necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with incisions and punctures, and also ventoses (suction cups), and plagues (perhaps referring to infected wounds or diseases), and the extraction of arrows and similar objects. It is entirely organized according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of twists and similar conditions; a capitulated order from within the foot, and of the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	With fire cautery and acute medicine, and the recollection of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the youth of that cautery and the documents of it, and in what condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it says that the discourse on the quality of cautery's youth and the documents thereof is a long and prolix speech, subtle for knowledge, and secrets hidden; and much has been said about it by many wise men, and there are disagreements among them, and to me, a small part of their discourses suffices, fearing prolongations.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cauterization will benefit every complete whole universally, whether it be of material or its material, except for two complexes, which are complexes with their own material.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex with dry and hard material, it becomes disconnected; for some say that cauterization is beneficial to this condition, while others say the opposite, that cauterization is not appropriate for a disease caused by dryness and hardness, since the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it would be inappropriate to treat a disease that is dry and hard with heat and dryness.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite state that cauterization is beneficial for all dry and hard diseases that are found in human bodies, since when you compare the human body and its humidity to the nature of fire, you find the human body dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And they say by way of argument that they have already experimented with this many times before to discover it.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for anyone who has already been exhausted and practiced in the chapter of cautery for subsequent exercises, and who has known the diversity of the composition of humans and the disposition of their ailments within their bodies, the causes of those, and the accidents that befall them, as well as the passage of time regarding those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, there is no cause for fear, especially in the treatment of cold and wet ailments, as all doctors are in agreement regarding these, and they do not disagree on the use of cautery to treat them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know this, my sons, that the secret of treatment by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, lie in cautery over medicinal fires, for fire is simple; its action only affects the member that is cauterized, and does not harm other members nearby, but rather with a small injury.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of medicinal fires reaches those members where it is applied, and strongly affects the diseased member that is difficult to heal, aiding greatly in its recovery.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Light, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not cause this but rather superfluity. It is already known to us through experience and the long study of the art concerning the truth of causes; for this reason, I excuse the length of my speech, and if it were not that this secret fire, hidden in your body, cannot be read at my leisure, I would have demonstrated by philosophical discourse the quality of the operation in the body and its expulsion through which you eliminate ailments, which would sharpen your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that the times of the year when cautery and binding are most effective are in the springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cautery is appropriate at all times, so that the damage caused by time is overshadowed by the healing of what is thrown off by cautery, especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, sharp and decisive, which do not suffer delay, for it is feared of those that come with evil, which is better than to permit further damage to enter through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And so you should not sit on your feet, or sons, for it is only the common people and foolish doctors who consider this disease, which is healed by cautery, to be entirely cured, and they pause at its consequences.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not thus as they believe for it, because cautery is only a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up the humors which are the cause that pain comes.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, one may use cautery superfluously over medicine because of the desire for its power and virtue in operation and the greatness of their lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his illness may return at some time in the future, according to the composition of the illness and the location of his illness, and the virtue of him, and what is prepared within him from the addition of superfluities and humors, and what has been acquired by him through food and similar causes; otherwise, the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a few superfluities and humors, so with dental cautery for pain and similar things, it is possible that the same pain may not return in him, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is often said in popular speech that the cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a right saying, not because those who understand it believe that it is a cure that profit from medicine or any other cause with cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is to the contrary; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not but when one administers methods of healing in some illnesses, and those medicines do not take effect, and at the end of the cause, one administers a cautery, and it profits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here it follows that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of the common people and many of the folk physicians.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a gold cautery is better than an iron cautery, and they did not say this but for the equality of the gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not cause pain, which is not entirely true, for you have already seen and experienced that it only causes pain in certain bodies, and cauterizing with fire is good and better than as they said; however, when you make a cautery with hot gold, it is not declared to you, for the gold is consumed according to the quantity you want because of the heat of the fire, and if you place it over the flame, the gold melts into the fire, and sometimes some sheets fall into the fire so that the craftsman suffers from the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cauterizing with iron must be done more lightly and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	You have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and you have ordered those from the beginning related to the feet, so now I will address what he wants from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Using a hot cautery for headache caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	**First Chapter**
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers upon the servant the benefit of humidity and cold, two causes that are the primary source of many rheumatic fluxes, called rigor, from the head to the parts of the senses and of the ears, flowing abundantly, as well as during sleep, and pain in teeth and the throat, and generally for all ills that appear due to cold, similarly to paralysis, sudden weakness, apoplexy, and similar conditions in those ills.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, command that the illness be evacuated using a laxative on the head, for three or four nights, according to the severity of the illness, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then he commands them to shave their head, and make that cut between your thighs on a stretcher, and place his hands on the patient's feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then he places the edge of his palm near the patient's nose, between their feet.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the pain in the middle part of the body has been relieved, mark that place with a sign, and then light the olive-shaped cautery whose form is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then he places that on the healthy place marked with a sign, descending in such a way that the patient's hand is slowly constrained, and you remove it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then he slowly lifts his hand and examines the place, and if you notice that any bone is exposed or there is any quantity of blood, lift your hand, and if it does not return to that spot or another, especially if it is cold, then it is as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply pressure over the soaked area at the border, and leave it on until the burn scale falls off.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with an ointment made of four ingredients until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the plague opens the skin, the wound heals better and more quickly. Therefore, it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They also say that the bone should be cauterized within the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the specific nature of the bone is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then remove what is attached to the bone, and clean it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they said others that a pointed cautery should be used on the rear, as it first strengthens the bone deeply, and then relaxes it, and this is the shape of the small cataplasm:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, the vapours of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then it should be treated until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not recommend these two types of cautery to everyone, but rather only to certain people out of fear; and this should be avoided, for me, unless it is absolutely necessary, because the head has been deprived by the solution of its continuity, as we have witnessed in other members, especially when the head of the patient is of a frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cautery that comes first is most beneficial and safe for me, and it is from that practice that health comes to this work.

Del cauteri del cap.	On the cautery of the head.

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	**On the Cauterization of Nose Putridity.**

When treating the condition we described in the previous section and your treatment is ineffective, then prepare a mixture for the patient to drink for three nights; and shave their head, and cauterize with a middle-sized cautery or olive-sized cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then apply cautery with a claw-shaped instrument on both eyelids, leaving the hairs intact.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the shape of the claw-shaped instrument for cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the softening cautery of the eyelids for the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, apply cautery to that eyelid with a claw-shaped instrument; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, apply cautery to both eyebrows with a small instrument in the shape of two cauters, extending them from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the swelling.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with the cautery, but according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is adhering.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cautery of the eyelid, when the hairs turn to scabs inside and press on the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eyelid turn to scabs inside and press on the eye, cautery is performed in two ways: either by making a cut or using a medicated burning cautery.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you are using a fire cautery, order the patient to open their eyes wide, so that they look at things with both eyes, and if you need to, place a bandage on them to prevent any further damage while the hairs fall out.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are clean and prepared, place the patient's head on the bed, and then carefully inspect the soles of their feet, looking for a sign resembling a dead leaf, which is where the symptom usually begins.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply a cold compress or a wet cloth on the sole.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And apply the hot cautery, which is shaped like this.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And cauterize along the shaped area, little by little, in repeated passages, until the surface of the wound is completely healed, just as if it were covered with a leaf of myrtle, clearly visible.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of recovery is that you see the eyelid of the eye contract and the patient's hair stand on end at the site of the cautery on the sole.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so raise your hand and place it there for three days, then apply a poultice to the affected area until the swelling subsides.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that remedy until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If it returns for any reason and the eyelid becomes softened, then do the cautery again on that entire area just as you did originally.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hair is in the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position, sealed, and the hair does not produce any odor.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with a burning medicine is what you order for the patient to remove the hair so that it does not grow back and is sealed; then make a cut in the shape of a fir leaf using a piece of cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take a known soap and an active cause of one or the other, mix those good causes together, and make it into a paste so that it is not frozen; spread this from it on paper made in the shape of a myrtle leaf, and place it on one or both wounds; leave the fragrant part soaked in egg white albumen, and the patient's head in the cold air.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then stop talking about the medicine and apply a small amount, but not too much, so that the patient does not feel the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like fire in it.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, when the patient no longer feels the bite of the medicine, cease its use and apply a cold compress to the affected area; then consider whether the eyelid is lifted as it should be after washing away constriction by fire or incision, for that is the sign of healing; if it does not return to the application of this medicine in the place where it was not absorbed, do not worry, for your operation will succeed and the wound will heal.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply pressure to the area until the pain of adhesion is eradicated, and care for it with a definite ointment or other treatment until it heals.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, in your operation, to have great care that no part of the medicine falls out of the eye, and if the eyelid becomes softened after a few days because of some cause related to the hairs in the eye, then continue your treatment on that place where the eyelid has become softened, just as you did at the beginning, and surround it until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of making an extract from myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the eyes of men vary in size and shape, and therefore your treatment must be adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And this way of treatment should not be hidden from anyone who is studying this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the method we have described for these maladies and your treatment does not work, then know that you should cauterize it as follows: command the patient to hold their head in a certain position, and place some instrument between their teeth so that they do not move or agitate their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a small piece of cloth soaked in honey or a mixture of feathers and dust on the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then shape the cautery as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be curved, similar to the shape of a cane or a quill, at one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you look, they penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to get out this way, try it cautiously.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Yet he who is experienced is better at the time work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open, and try to clean and dry that part.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from that part.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place over it the hot cautery, and with your hand protect the part from the heat of the cautery at the root of the nose, so that your hand or the illness is not disturbed, and apply the cautery to the grey parts of the nose and burn that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of applying the cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice, as necessary; leave it in place for three days, and then apply pressure to that area with a border and envelop it in a drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing ten days it does not heal, apply a sharp, corrosive medicine to it until the bone is exposed and then scrape it as seems appropriate in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another way to apply a cautery for a fistula, which some first described: enter the location of the fistula and burn it, then return to that small fissure from which it originated, and apply the amount of molten lead equal to a fingernail; hold your hand over it with good retention so as not to harm the patient because the molten lead does not reach the wound; cover the area where you place the cautery with alum or water, so that the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through a marvelous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, it is good; otherwise, it will be necessary to administer a drain from the nose and reduce the fistula to the nasal cavity according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On cauterization of the hernial orifice.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Various occasions lead to the occurrence of fissures in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures as we have said in the divisions and do not take advantage of your treatment, then use a hot iron in the shape of a knife according to this form that is shown:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And the concavity of it according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place your hand carefully between those cracks so that the cautery reaches the depth of the cracks.

Capitol .xix.	**Chapter XIX**
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	**On the Cauterization of Fistulas in the Mouth**
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When, during the extraction of an uvula or in the palate or in the roots of teeth there is an abscess and it bursts, and it becomes ancient, and a fistula forms, and you treat it but do not allow healing, then you must ignite a cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, and insert that flame into the passage of the fistula, and with your hand guide the burning flame to its depth, doing this once or twice; and then care for it as we have said regarding treatment until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And thus if the wound is incised and healed, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to uncover the location and remove the corrupt bone as described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	**Capitol XX:**
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the treatment of teeth and the softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and these conditions are treated with medicines rather than surgery, then place the patient's head in a suitable position, and shape the cautery so that it can be applied to the tooth. Then place your finger on the tooth and insert the burning cautery into it, holding it for a short time until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth, which has been reached.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand and repeat the application of the cautery several times, as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient gargle with salt water for an hour, after which they should spit it out, as the decayed tooth will be secured, the softened gums will tighten, and the corrupted moisture will dry up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness or there is swelling or pus, and the treatment with medicine does not help, one uses cautery on that area in two ways: either with a cattle horn cautery or with a fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a cattle horn involves taking the horn of a cow and piercing it in the fire, then holding the cautery over the affected tooth, wrapping the cloth around the tip, immersing it in hot water, and applying it to the aching tooth until it is numbed.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, dip a cloth or cloth in the wound on its side, place that over the painful tooth, and place the burning iron on it until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire only addresses the outer layer of the wound or the skin, and it should not be too harsh or rough, nor should the heat of the fire reach the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery as needed, place it over the tooth, and hold your hand over it until the cautery cools; do this several times as the pain may resurface the next day or later.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that the patient opens their mouth wide with the help of the cautery, hold it for an hour, then spit it out; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply the cautery where you have seen the extreme, as much as you can.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the catheter:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On cauterization of hernias.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are filled with fluid and humors that are resistant to digestion by medicines, and you need to expel them slightly, then apply the cautery directly to their form, having two sharp ends so that the fire from the cautery can reach both sides. E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of wounds and the constriction of veins.
