Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization of the dislocated ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humors infiltrate the area around the ankle, and cause its swelling, and a sign of it is that the affected part is prolonged over the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is narrowed down to which boot it is in.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then apply the cautery to the hernia at the opening of the anus with a circular cauterization, for you will have already tried to loosen the ring around the opening as it is turned, and thus the opening falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the shape of the cautery mentioned above is also used in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	If this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three large olive cautery irons.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the intensity of the pain from all over the body, and be careful that it is sane.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XL:
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the Cauterization of the Sciatic Vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain appears in the lower part of the body, caused by cold and moisture, the disease is treated with the water we have mentioned and do not give any other thing, and this is ancient, then you should reduce the disease from thick humors with putrid pills or artificial pills or similar ones; and treat it with cautery.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the way of the cautery on that is according to two ways: either cautery with medicinal burners, or cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It follows according to two knowledgeable ways, of which one is to cauterize it in the gap of the patient's anus with three triangular cauteries according to this form; and make those sufficiently deep.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And both the spaces between each cautery should be according to the thickness of what is being treated, and whether the cautery is olive-sized or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Some times, cautery can be applied to the middle part of the ankle for it to be four cauterizations.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize the circle from which the shape precedes in the cauterization of the dislocated ankle, one that is circular and burns away the inflammation of all the tendons.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cautery in chronic cases when pain is attached to the ankle and not spread within the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it is spread within the thigh, then cauterize that as two cauterizations on the thigh over the place where you have turned the malady that causes the pain; and one cauterization on the shin bone four times a day from the outer part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cuticular, then the depth of the cautery should be according to the quantity of inflammation of the tendon.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the disease causes the pain to radiate towards the feet, then apply a cautery here where you see it needs cauterization with three or four or more points if required for that part.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the disease causes pain to remain in the thigh, then apply a cutting cautery here where it is felt.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterization so that you do not end with cautery on nerves or great damage, and thereby to yourself cause more harm than the disease does to the patient.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And you have already seen others of those who cauterize on the ankle and complete the cauterization, and a bed of fire inflated within that the growth achieved its foot, and fire pierced and corrupted all the foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then cause a strong acid solution of the belly, and thereby bring about death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, simultaneously apply cautery to each according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And certain wise men spoke of the cauterization of water cauteries, of which this is the manner: make it resemble a circular iron ring whose circumference is the width of a palm; and its orifice should be according to the thickness of a date palm bone or slightly more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle there should be another third; and the space between them should be equal to the width of a palm; and these circles should have two parts; and the length of these sides should be a palm or two palms, and make on the edge of the iron circles a proper incision in the shape of them.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then light it in the fire until it curls and sparks, and once it is paused over the part of water, place the patient on their side with the afflicted area above.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And therefore cauterize that part with three red hot cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that for three days; then bind up the wound with a poultice and keep the ulcer open for several days; and then tend to it with ointment until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: O, my sons, of this kind of cautery we have used little due to the fear of looking at it, and because few of us have found those who look at it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	One should apply the best cautery to him who suffers from it, and find out the right place for it.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	One should use cautery instead of medicines when, after making two circles with a perforated armature made of iron, you insert the guaffo (a hook or claw) into the door; let the length of the wall be such that its width is equal to two nuts or the size of those used.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between certain parts of the body is such that it corresponds to the thickness of the said part, they should be opened and left open, and they should hold themselves together according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place your hand over the part where the patient feels pain in the side, and take some cold water, forming it into two circles, and gradually decrease its temperature with fire, keeping it for an hour, and allowing the patient to endure the burning and compression—for that burning sensation is as if it were from fire—until the burning ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand with the instrument and wipe away the cold water from all parts of the affected area with warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Then apply this for three days and place your hand on the affected area until the swelling decreases, and repeat this for several days, and it will cure the pain; this is best in youth.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then attend to that wound until it heals.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	If the pain is widespread in the thigh or leg, make him lie down so that water can be poured into him as has been done with the other patient.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the manner of making water, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the correction of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Prepare a mixture of alkali and cause no extinction from both parts, cut them and place in a new vessel from which the opening has been perforated by a small tool according to the quantity that goes into it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And leave the base of the vessel in another vessel filled with fresh water, and then place over it the mixture of alkali and causes, alive water, two fingers deep, and after you have compressed them well, let the hot water from the mixture flow down into the cold water in the other vessel.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water, and pour it over another living cause and other alkaline renewals, so that it becomes a very powerful sharp substance, which is administered in many medical operations and in the cauterization of the other members, because operation uses fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And indeed, some of the medicines that are cauterized include those with a sharp and clean edge and cause a burning and pleasant sensation, thus they are mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	Now let me relate a tale of an ancient man who performed an operation and provided cure for pain in the kidneys and sciatica, and marvel at how wonderful it was considered to be. He claimed that no other treatment was necessary as this one healed completely with a single application; for he would immerse the affected part in hot water and it would heal from then on.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	It is also important to consider the freshness of the herbs, and if they are not available, take a fig leaf; twist them with some salt and place them on the water where the pain is located, be it in the kidney, the thigh, or the leg, and heat them.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for a duration of three hours, or for as long as the illness requires relief from pressure.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then immerse them in hot water, and when the body is relaxed, place the stone on the affected area, as the pain will cease and healing will occur.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And be aware that one should not use cautery with these remedies unless it is for the purpose of releasing congestion from the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	It may already be said that when the small vein in the goat's foot is cauterized, it brings relief; and the cautery should be applied to it in this manner: take wool and dip it in old oil, and place it between the toes of the foot and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And take a dried goat's vein and apply it to the inflamed area with hot coals, then place the wool on top and leave it until it is stretched.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this process, and do not cease to do so until the sensation of the bite enters the water and relieves the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cautery is called the "ox cautery.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On the cauterization of joint pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain is felt in the back for various reasons, such as due to injury or impact, or from excessive evacuation, and for similar causes, through the infusion of foreign, irritating material.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cauterization does not apply to any other kind but this specific one caused by the infusion of foreign, irritating material.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, in order to evacuate the malady, make pills that resemble them, which are placed on the side where the pain is felt, three lines according to its extent, and apply cautery on each line, depending on the quantity you see from the patient's tolerance and the virtue of the remedy.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And cauterization should be made with a pointed cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, cauterize with three cauteries or four with medial claw cautery according to this form:
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XXXIII.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization at the onset of gout.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	This malady should be watched closely in young children; the sign of its onset in children is that it causes tightness in their small joints, raising and limiting their movements.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And it examines the last spinal bone of the back and the joints that already begin to overhang above the other spinal bones.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And so when you observe this and wish to prevent it, cauterize it with a curved cautery in the following shape:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	that takes the cautery across the entire span of the spine.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, cauterize around the spine with a pointed cautery in two or three lines.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And the points should be appropriate among themselves.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	Then carefully tend to the area as it heals, as we have said.
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	Be careful that a cautery is not applied to a swelling caused by nerve spasm.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And thus, when gout caused by cold is treated with warmth and the pain does not cease, then cautery may be employed.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	It is because you cauterize the proper evacuation in the flow of the joint of the foot with various cauteries.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And take a olive-shaped cautery whose form is thus:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	If the pain increases within the toes or other joints and this persists often, then cauterize that over any toe with three or four cauteries from this olive-shaped cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if you find that these cauteries are sufficient for your needs, then cauterize accordingly and do not press too hard with the cautery against the skin, only focus on the specific area of the joint.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	If the pain persists within the toe and its surroundings, then administer the cautery as we have mentioned in the previous chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pain is in the muscles only and is called tetany, then make points along the course of the tendons as they twist, in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pain persists in these areas, make points along the course of the tendons on each joint and on the pinched nerve of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pain can also spread to joints or muscles, then apply a cautery to any affected areas on the limbs.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not remove the illness without proper treatment and receipt of medicines, for if good treatment is followed and inflammation is removed with this cautery, God will help.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLVI
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	**On Cauterization of Fractures**
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When you need to break open the angles and expose the hernias beneath the bandage at the groin, this is how you begin: ensure that you instruct the patient to stop eating on that day and use gentle causes to prevent the gap from widening in their abdomen.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	Then continue to massage the patient between your hands on their back, and command them to keep their mind relaxed, so that the opening or appearance of the hernia or intestines may occur.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	Then return the intestines to their place, and gently attempt to open up the gap in the pelvic bone; mark the end of it, which will be similar to a half-circle in the upper openings of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	Then prepare the cautery whose shape is as follows:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	it should be sharp and have thin edges.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from coming out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	And you have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then apply the cautery to that sign with your hand, holding the cautery upright, and insert it where you have achieved access to the bone of the thigh within the muscles; repeat this another time if you did not achieve it on the first attempt within the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe wisely the setting of the hernia during the cauterization, so as not to injure that hernia and cause death or other great harm to the patient.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And be aware that if during cauterization you do not hold the bone, your operation will not be successful.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And be sure that the cautery of children is subtle according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And then care for the site of the cautery for three days, applying borders until the fire scar is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then care for it as with other burns until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should be made to lie on their back for 10 days until the site is sealed and the pain disappears.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And be aware that the patient should abstain from food according to the duration of their healing, which strengthens their belly, and that the intestine should not protrude due to effort in recovery.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then, after about 10 days, administer the medicine properly and keep them on rest for another 40 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And he should reduce his labor and intake of food and drink, and avoid strong voices, for when one follows this regimen of healing diligently, they will be made whole.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And now I will describe the treatment for hernias in other parts of the abdomen, which begins with the formation of a hole, and if it does not heal, cauterize the hernia with a pointed cautery according to its size, and drain the fluid that has accumulated from the intestines; and then apply the treatments as mentioned earlier, without compression.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And it has been said by some that the hernia should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this method, as it is observed and tried.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and a line is made for the hernia's enlargement on both sides, then another line above it; and place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cauterization should be lighter and better done.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter .xlvi.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of twists.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain in various members arises from a twist or blow and persists for a long time without yielding to medical treatment, then apply cauterization with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the type of cautery should be according to the size and depth of the member, and its strength and position, and the location of the twist and pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is healed by the first cauterization, be satisfied; otherwise, repeat the cauterization; for usually those pains are punctures in members closest to that member, so you must succeed with cauterization within the time of illness.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .XLVII.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers sometimes need cauterization due to severe damage, especially if the type of leprosy is caused by putrefaction of the flame and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so if you wish to cauterize this, consider whether the leprosy is severe and if it responds to treatment as described in the previous division, nor does it spread or remain, but be wary of the illness that the corruption encompasses the whole body and all its parts; then cauterize that part on top of the head with a cautery: at the middle point of the head, and at the second part underneath, you can treat the forehead at the end of the hair; and both on two horns; and one behind, over the nape or serving it.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	Finally, with your hand on the cautery, slightly press it against the bone where it causes a slight impression, and dislodge the scales, so that the expulsion of thick vapors is relieved; and cauterize over the flesh as needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If leprosy has already spread over the body and appears manifestly, then cover it with cauterization using those cauteries we have mentioned before; cauterize on the tip of the nose, two cauteries on each eye socket, two cauteries on both sides of the spine at the nape, five cauteries on the spine, one on either side near the coccyx, one over the coccyx, and two on each ankle, one on each toe, and two on each thigh and muscle; cauterize all the joints of the hands and feet, and on every talon of their feet, and around the fissures of their bodies.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves on the sole that you do not hurt those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes it is cauterized with a cautery on the bone of the thigh and another over the mouth of the stomach, and another on the spleen.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you should know that the more precise the cautery, the greater its benefit and the more effective it is; also know that illness does not reside in the cautery, as it does in its parts, for this reason the body of the patient is already stunned.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And consider that the size of the cautery should be great or small according to the members and joints as previously mentioned concerning the kinds of instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then apply the cautery with fine flour mixed with honey and other remedies, as long as it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization for stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is paralyzed or numb and not healed through medicines, oils, and poultices, then you cauterize that paralyzed member with cautery according to the size of the member or the extent of its numbness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your hot cautery enter slightly into the wound of the cord.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then apply that remedy until it heals.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	Sometimes, cautery is applied to some parts which cause pain extending to the limbs and feet, and the spinal columns, and as a result, one can see the condition of the nerves that affect that member, and the pain subsides.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	One must not attempt this unless one is skilled in the anatomy of the members and the exit of nerves throughout the body's movements.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter .XLVIII (or .xlix)
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On cauterization of ulcerations that are festering.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When the wound is old and does not heal with any of the common medicines, then apply a cautery to it with a pointed instrument according to the quantity of the specific kind of cord until the white and color of the wound are restored, and the color of the wound is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then prepare a mixture of flour from beans and lentils with rose oil and leaves of arnicagosa (arnica), or pigeon's blood or deer's blood, each one separately and all mixed together, and apply a cloth over the area until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de cranc.	**Cauterization of Cramps:**
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins to eat away at a limb, and you wish to stop it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference as it revolves.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the scholars say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of the affected area; however, I have not seen this, as I fear it might be an ulcer, and I have seen this happening a few times before.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is instead more effective to cauterize it around the circumference of the limb in a circular manner, as we have said, or with multiple cauterizations.
Capitol .li.	Chapter.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On cauterization of abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When an abscess takes too long to heal, this may be due to its own excess or the state of the illness, as it is old and with little blood flow, or because of time, and you wish to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize around its circumference with multiple small punctate cauterizations; and then remove that, as it will slow down its maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena. Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cautery for corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a wandering corruption of the member, which eats away just as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you encounter that corrosion in a location which requires cautery with fire, then heat cautery clamps, both small and large, as appropriate for the place where the corrosion is located.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then apply the cautery from every side until you eliminate all corruption and do not leave any cause for it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Then bind it for three days, and place your hand on the cauterized areas every third day with a mixture of oil until all scars are completely eliminated and all corruption removed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	Then cure it with a poultice of fresh meat.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	It may be three days before the flesh grows healthy and free from corruption, which is good; if not, apply the cautery again over what breaks in the corrupted areas.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And sometimes it is treated with sharp medicine, for that is half the work of cauterization.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, cauterization with fire is more suitable for older patients.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And you have already described the cure for him using sharp medicine in the division, so take that which you will need from him when he is ready.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the cauterization of wounds and similar conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Occasions where there are severe, ruptured wounds in the parts of the foot affected by malady, which is called a claw, and these wounds cause great pain; cauterization on such areas is performed in two ways, either with fire or with water-driven cautery.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	The fire cautery is done by igniting the cautery tool similar to a tourniquet's pain, made of iron according to the amount contained in the wound from start to finish, and it should have subtle edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then apply that fire to the joint, and revolve your hand with the cautery around the joint until the cautery reaches the depth of the joint.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave that there for three days until it begins to throb.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then apply that compress, made of wild malvas (mallow) mixed with salt, over the affected area for one night, so that it is eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a poultice of generative flesh (or healing ointment) until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it is not cured, and outbreaks again on the surface of the body, especially in the joints and feet, then you must administer to those cauterizations with water, and take a small pipe of earth or iron or a pen-shaped instrument, and apply that over the joint; then immerse the tip of the pipe in little water, and place your hand, and revolve it with compression from your hand entirely, and continually turn the edge of the pipe along the root of the joint, and you will see the water being drawn out towards the root of the joint. And wait for the patient to bear the slight sting of the water for an hour, then remove that, because the joint will be freed from its roots.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus they do to those who have them, approaching another who comes over all of theirs that are in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And they also take care of those pus that the roots of the clots have been eradicated with heat, which the flesh ingests.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter III.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization of tremor.

When you encounter any tremor caused by irritation of the nerves or by fever from a contaminating cause, or by any other similar reason, you should know that you cauterize it with four cauterizing irons or with two on each spine of the back, between each spine placing one iron; and also cauterize on the patient's feet, and over their stomach, using olive-shaped cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of him rests and hastens the healing of the ill health that afflicts.

De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On cautery for white accidents in the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When white spots appear on the body and form pustules consisting of corrupt, thick matter, begin by treating them at their onset with a subtle cautery or a heated iron, the tip of which is extended over the entire fistula; or with a long, thin blade; or with a lenticular cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	In other cases, cautery is also applied at the beginning of their expulsion in this manner; they are not broken, and the excess matter is expelled, healing those affected.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it may also be necessary to perform an evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of flux of blood from a wound by incision of the archer.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Wounds caused by arrows that have been cut and infected, or when there is an opening due to the incision of a hernia or cautery on a member, then it appears similar, and it is difficult to contain that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens to anyone, you should use your hand over the wound of the arrow, and press down on it, tighten those parts seen as open until the flow of blood stops, so that it does not occur again.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then place the olive hot cauteries on the fire, a few large ones and many small ones, and blow on them until they become ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from those a small or large one according to the location and the wound in which an artery is broken, over which you have squeezed the pus as mentioned, and cauterize it until it is incised and that blood is stopped.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifices of the artery as you apply pressure and remove the cautery, take another cautery carefully from those that are prepared in the fire, and do not cease to do this again until the bleeding is stopped.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to irritate the nerve here, which may bring about other evils for the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you should know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to restrict the bleeding, especially when the artery is large, unless by one of four methods: either with a cautery as we have said, or by extraction when it is not extracted, for when its ends are cut off, the extremities are burnt and the bleeding is restricted; or by binding it tightly with string or ligature, or pausing over it medicines whose virtue restricts the blood flow; and they should be tightened on a pillow or in a compression bandage.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	He who administers a decent restriction of it with bandages or by the position of burning causes and similar ones, does not bring relief but only aggravates it.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If this must be done for anyone and neither the doctor nor medicine is present, then open at the indicated site on the affected vein as we have said, and understand the great constriction of it within that the flow of the plague is stopped; and regarding the hardness, it should not be resisted; and wash it with freezing cold water until the vein is frozen and thickened; and consider what cautery or medicine is needed.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second step.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Regarding incisions, punctures, blisters, phlebotomy, plaies, and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are words from Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have discussed in the first chapter all manner of illness where fire cautery is appropriate and medicinal fires are useful, along with their occasions and causes, and the instruments necessary for them according to the forms of cautery; and I have ordered the chapters on the treatment of conditions from the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And in this chapter, we will proceed in this manner so that those who seek knowledge here find relief, as much as possible, on the subject of their queries.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin this, know, children, that in this chapter, the topic is fearsome, as it was first discussed in the chapter on cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because it is important to exercise great caution, in the procedure discussed in this chapter, which involves drawing blood from the veins or making incisions into the abscesses, or draining pus, or cleansing wounds, or extracting arrows, or beginning treatments for stones—and all similar things—you must consider the following:
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all of these are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in most cases, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias. E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And it is of these that one gives to you advice and says, "Hope for health," and their illness is destructive.

De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of bleeding from cathartic drugs and from the downward flow of fluids from parts inside the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent. Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of what cats in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia. And so when a cat's claw or any other similar cause affects the ear, and the ear is painful and swelled, if the pain is intense, it sometimes discharges into some cause of polluted oil or pus, then carefully extract the foreign body and make the condition suitable to prevent sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then apply some soft cloth or wool to the ear canal and gently pull the ear away from the affected area, as heat and moisture are often effective against such causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	If it is not removed, then use the instrument called a delicate epichirurgical gesture to extract it.
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	If it is removed with the gesture, fine; if not, then carefully extract it using an instrument with a slight double fold.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if this is not forgotten, make a tube of aram and insert the end of the tube into the ear canal and close around the tube with softened wax and oil so that only the tube opens.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then, with a strong attraction, extract the foreign body that we have described.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	If it is not forgotten in this manner, take a piece of hot metal or a specially crafted instrument with which the stones are gently extracted, place it at the end of the ray, and then wrap it around that part neatly and securely.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the ear canal with ease and extract the ear from the moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore, if it is not forgotten regarding all the causes that we have described, then gently tie off that which causes gangrene or spasms.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the method of cutting it is that you begin by making incisions in the vein affected by the gout and extract the blood according to the virtue of its quantity, then make a cease between your fingers and convert the flap back to its original position, and make a small incision at the base of the flap where the gouty matter has been previously pressed.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And if the fracture is of a lunar shape that reaches the bone, and the bone is exposed, stop it with appropriate instruments if you can; then quickly treat the fracture while it is still fresh and cure it until it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the pain in the auricle is one of the swollen and inflamed fats, then administer treatment and extract it; but if you do not adhere to your eye's recommendation, then take some gentle, subtle suction according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer the removal of that fat which has fallen into the auricle.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not attempt this when you think the affected area is already moistened by the patient's breath, hold it in heavy weights, or extract it using forceps or any such instrument, because this complicates its removal.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	If water has entered the ear, which is the cause of the ailment leading to sneezing, and it fills the ear canal with some old wax, then press on that ear in which the water is, and if it is expelled through this pressure, it is good; otherwise, take a few small stones or beans according to their size, heat them slightly in the fire, and the patient should insert one of these into the opening of his ear and jump on one foot, pressing with the other foot on the stone or bean located inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	So do not stop until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already water has been drawn out thusly, taking paper or cloth, place one extremity of it in the ear and extend the other extremity towards the fire until the most part of it is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	Then take another cloth and do this many times until all the water is drawn out, and tear that from the tube as it is said of the water drawing stone.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	In the extraction of a foreign body entering that ear, if it is small, it can be removed with the same method and similar care as we have said in division; but if it is of great size which causes appearance at the sense of the wound, then administer the extraction of it by hand and scissors, and the cause of it is more lightly considered from all other causes that catch in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms born in the ear, when you treat that with the water as we have said in division and in the treatment of distills and do not agree with your care, then watch that you protect the ear from the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if any cause of worms appears here, then extract them by delicate gestures or means, but if no cause appears, take a tube from narrow at one end and wide at the other, the form of which is like this.
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	Then insert the subtil extreme into the ear according to the quantity of suffering from the malady; and then suck it with a strong suction, making motions as you do so, until all the worms are removed.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	If you do not obey to the extent required, then cover and close the tube with wax as we have said; administer the distillers which have already been prepared in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillation.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your flow be the one that pours medicinal oils into the ear, with this instrument, the form of which is like this:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make a small, straight incision in silver or bronze, leaving a narrow opening, and apply pressure on it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore, it is used to fill the cavity of the hernia here, which is necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the ray and wrap it around the end of the instrument neatly, then pour oil into the cavity of the hearing or any herbal juice, or whatever you prefer from these medicines into the canula — in the earlobe — then insert the ray under the skin and squeeze with your hand to create pressure until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the ear and the patient feels relief within.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is inserted into the earlobe should already be scorched with a small flame.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the cause you are distilling in the ear is not too harsh, because the ear medicines do not tolerate this.
Capitol .vii.	Capital VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear inflammation.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes, children's bellies can become inflamed due to their parents' undiagnosed or untreated ear infections, which can also affect adults. This inflammation can occur in the soft tissue of the ear or sometimes outside the ear canal.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And those that occur in the soft tissue, which do not comprehend (understand) the cause, are the most difficult to heal.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where you can identify the cause, take the affected ear away from the heat and observe it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you then observe an apparent bulge, open it gently with a delicate spatula, the form of which is as follows:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the edge of it where the width is required, of which one part is acute and the other not; and the blade is of two lengths sharp so as not to harm the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so if the operation is for a bone grown in the ear or in the flesh, then you make those delicate cuts and incisions with great ease until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the operation is on the edge of the ear, then take a fine razor and heat it slightly with fire, and then insert that into the flesh of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have sensed an operation that the patient finds easy due to the urgency, in order to relieve pressure, exert force on it easily; and be careful not to harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place on the ear a cloth according to the quantity of the width of the wound that you have wrapped in the Egyptian ointment; do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound; or take some and immerse it in water, sprinkle over it every third day, and use it. If the ear has already been bandaged, then be careful not to pour out the liquid and replace it with other liquid that you wrap in cloth that is made of oil, as long as the abscess cautiously gives way; and take care of it so that it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	If a flux of blood occurs, immerse the exposed or drape in warm water, place it on the wound, and use other remedies that restrict the flow of blood, which is mentioned in the distillation treatment.
Capitol .viii.	**Chapter VIII**
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	**On the treatment of athezel affecting the eyelids.**
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athezel that affects the eyelids of the eyes sometimes becomes moist, other times dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you should have these herbs or garlic, and extract the juice from them, and then place it over the affected areas, pressing gently.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	If pain accompanied by a blood flux occurs, then you should cauterize these with a fine, sharp cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is to make incisions and cuts observed, returning when there is any cause for their reopening; and when cauterized with fire, those cuts are burned away and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	**Chapter IX**
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	**Treatment for a severe condition that comes to the eyelids of the eyes.**
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Observed motes or growths on the eyelids of the eyes due to some cause that resembles a severe condition in its strength and hardness, hence it is called grandiose.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is characterized by the addition of a thick humidity on both the lower and upper eyelids.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation on them considers whether, when the growth is proceeding from the eyelid and is severe throughout, the cause of it is slight.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, open that narrow fissure according to its extent, and carefully extract it from every part until it is completely removed, and then suspend it and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	If the beginning of the hernia is not clearly visible, but it is only felt upon careful incision into the eyelid, then this should not be noted for any particular cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the hernia is large, then you should adjust it with sutures; and tend to that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, then you will not suffer greatly from that place as the hernia's own healing restores and covers it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the size is decreasing within the eyelid, you should expose the surface within, then raise the eyelid and suspend the hernia with a weight, other than what you usually use for the incision, and press it from all sides, and if the eyelid itself is elongated through the incision, this should not be noted for any particular cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then make the incision, wash the wound with salty water; and treat the area with liquid until it heals.
Capitol .x.	**Chapter X**
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the treatment of an acute condition on the upper eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Acute inflammation is caused by the condition affecting the upper eyelid's tunic, and it tends to occur more frequently in children, leading to painful eyes and sometimes causing cataracts; and due to this, they cannot bear the brightness of the sun, as tears accumulate at these eyes.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you must keep those eyes covered over their faces all the time, and over their eyes rest the eyebrows, which have already covered inflammation, and the imminent threat of accumulation is apparent in the eye; and when you press the area with your fingers, you feel acuteness within those eyes.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And in some manner of operation, if the patient's disease rests on their thigh, then drape cloth over them and make it warm, and form it into a circle according to the quantity that contains an arthron from every part, and place that over this one, and press with your hands all around for so that an additional amount is added in the middle of the circle, and finish in the middle of that moistened tissue by cutting incidentally through the fissure per its width, and the fissure should not be greater than the fissure made in flaubotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	Place the needle in the opening until you reach the hernia, for in the most delicate positions, hernia is extracted through a fissure according to the form of white grease.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, remove those cloths which you have wrapped between your fingers and pulled them out from the parts outside, and turn with your right and left hand until they are completely extracted.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to press on the fissure so that the spatula does not reach the wrong place and cause damage to it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	If the artery does not appear open at the beginning of the fissure, then adjust in the fissure a small piece of facilitating material while it processes the artery; and then extract that as we have said; and place cloths from it in water and wine and press them over the area and apply those as powders.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And some put salt and press it into the cavity of the fissure so that what is removed from that moisture is drawn out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then care for it so that it heals.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	If an accident occurs at the posthemic location with a cautery, then care for it using plaster until it heals.
