And if there are auricles attached that must be removed, carefully cut the flesh in which they are embedded from all sides with all the means at your disposal; and devise something, if you cannot remove the flesh from the fracture of the auricles and their torsion until it becomes possible to reduce them.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in any place, use torction with your hand and forceps from all sides until it yields; and with subtlety and care, so that the arrow is not broken and can be easily removed along with its tip.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot reach it with your forceps, then leave it for a few days until the parts that are in the path of the arrow can be separated, and then repeat the procedure when the pain has subsided.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If you experience difficulty due to bleeding, then administer what we have mentioned for treatment in its section.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And be mindful of your skill in incising veins or nerves, or string, and administer remedies in every possible way to facilitate the escape of the arrow; do this with ease and tranquility, delay and firmness as much as you can, both for yourself and as recommended by others.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, contract the arrow in such a way that the disease is according to the figure by which you must aim the target of the arrow, for this is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If this is not within your ability, then administer what is within your ability according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	Consider the arrows that are shot against the opposite side or have already pierced through any part on the outside, or become stiffened at the tip due to the pressure from below, and twist those; then place your hand over it; and according to the quantity in which the forceps grasp it, cut it off; and throw it away, for it is of no use.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is held in the bone, cut your knife according to the direction of the arrow that pierces the bone, and deepen the cut until it exits, then remove it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if that does not work, leave it for a few days and then repeat the procedure as often as necessary.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft of the arrow is within the bone, then push it towards the arrowhead.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft has fallen off and you want to apply force, insert a sharp object and, if it is hard, strike it with force into the hollow of the bone at the base of the arrowhead, then push it towards the arrowhead.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrowhead is concave, push it firmly with a sharp object while entering it, as this will cause the arrowhead to recede due to that pressure.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is embedded, then you must press all your concave flesh where it truly is, if you can do so, and tend to that area as best as you can.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow strikes the foot, or the abdomen, or the bladder, or the side, and it is close enough that you can touch it without difficulty, and it is possible for you to do so, then grasp it and pull it out, and be careful not to cut into veins or nerves, and treat the wound as needed until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps used to extract arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their ends should be shaped like a bird's beak, made with a saw tooth, to grip the arrow firmly so that it does not slip.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And these are made in various sizes, large, small, and medium, according to the amount of the arrow's thickness, and the depth of its penetration, and the extent of the wound, and the tightness of the area affected.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of pushing out the concavity of this extremity with pain from outside so that the arrow's intrusion is removed from it and the pressure from inside is relieved.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	The method of relieving a sore extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	so that the arrow's intrusion into the concave sagita is removed and it is pushed out of there.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On venipuncture (vein cutting).
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua. Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps. sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	it cuts the width of the vein as it passes, and it opens the concave veins full of thick substances by proceeding apparently grossly, and to those containing thick blood clots.

E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux. And the quality of the flebotomy is that the disease is bathed, and quickly and tightly it extracts the fluid from the deep layers between the skin on all four sides with a long, thin bandage, so that only this is seen.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and the qualities of use of those.

E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Ventilation is achieved through two methods: one involves the incision and extraction of pus, and the other involves ventilation through the same incision.

La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that in men where the sanium (or humor) increases, there is a greater need for venesection; and they find it most severe and acute. Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that must be done to regulate the flow of blood after phlebotomy before ventilation?

Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Use ery or citrus, with thick margins, lion, donkey, and turtle shells to prevent the member from moving out of its position.

E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the bellows of children and the weak are different from the bellows of young men and strong bodies.

E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda. E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And adjust the fire according to your preference, and repeat if needed.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament. Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.

Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is as bad as an illness, causing disruption in the chain of treatment, and it comes to mind again, as mentioned in the second chapter, according to its particularities.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that a completely broken member is not tightly bandaged on the first day; this is because, when the member is large, it cannot be held by bandages alone, but must be wrapped properly after several days, or fifth, or seventh, depending on your confidence in the healing without apothema.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of the plasterers that the ancients used, which are placed over fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of plastering as a quick restoration for fractures, especially useful for complex cases and particularly for women and children, because it does not allow heat or friction: take flour dust, the very heart of the flour that prevents the movement of the millstone against the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And if it is not possible to do so, then take a fine cloth, and prepare the composition not too thick or thin; and use it accordingly.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of plastering to restore fractures and dislocations: prepare assafetida, ladanum, acacia, enula, and myrrh, which are crushed from dragon's blood, mirra, and aloe, each in equal parts; all these ingredients should be mixed with alichil water or egg albumen if the patient's wound is clean; then apply this plaster, as it is of good composition and gently restores broken bones, and will benefit many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another plastering method for fractures and twists: prepare myrrh and gum Arabic from dragon's blood, each in equal parts; add myrra and aloe, each in dragon's blood five times; acacia, six times; and Armenian silk, eight times.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All these ingredients should be ground in a mortar to a fine consistency, mixed with water or egg albumen and administered accordingly.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method for applying plasters to joints and bones separated from their places, causing pain in these and in cracks and fractures; take fine wool, submerge it in a mixture of wine and oil, and apply it to the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	This plaster is not only without restorative power but also prevents abscesses and effectively relieves pain.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method for a plaster that restores closed bones: take dried fig leaves and poppy leaves, mix them together, and make a plaster of them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A method for a quick-acting plaster used for bone fractures and to resolve abscesses: take cuttings from alder, chamomile, and violet flowers, also flour of earth (likely clay), mix them all together; make it into a paste and apply it to the affected area, unless the member is infected.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scalded, then apply that water of cold cucumber or water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of applying a poultice for stronger resolution than the first one mentioned is as follows: take alder bark and seeds of fennel, and lupine, and melilot, and marjoram, and violet flowers, and chamomile, from any source; all these should be crushed and mixed with lavender water or rosewater or vinegar, according to the quality of the member and the rest of the patient's condition.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	However, Hippocrates does not state in his treatise that the affected member should be rested before its restoration, but rather recommends applying a mixture of wax and oil, nor anything else; he also advises using a medium consistency between too thick and too thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	A hot compress can also be applied to the fractured member after its restoration and when there is lack of warmth due to cold, just as with myrrh, fennel seeds, and similar substances, in accordance with the causes previously mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A method of applying a plaster for injury and pain: take equal parts of lint, dried leaves from a man's beard or quail feathers, and salt, crush them together, mix and make a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount should be adjusted according to the extent of the injury and if there is no pain or discomfort or if the bone is not broken, it is not necessary to dislodge it immediately; then, you should not attempt to remove it hasty.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there is severe pain, pressure, or inflammation at the site, immediately remove or dislodge whatever is causing it and stop applying the plaster.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a piece of linen and marine sponge, soak them in warm water, and apply this to the area until the pressure and pain subside; then let the member rest for an hour. Afterwards, place over it some clean wool soaked in vinegar or rose oil, wrap it up, and leave it for a night, ensuring there is no further infection and that the inflammation of the member has subsided and the pain has lessened.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that narrow constriction, applying a small plaster and do not tighten it with your first restriction, but treat it gently until it heals.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess, swelling, pain, inflammation and all other symptoms have subsided, and you find a need for further treatment, then repeat that process as you initially began.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no such cause occurs in the member from those we have mentioned, then do not remove it, but leave it for three days or four or five or seven; and sometimes everything is left for twenty days, as you may see from the loosening of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and draws close to the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the constriction more than your initial constriction, and adjust in the thickness of the patient's food, according to the remembrance of that.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you examine the site of the fracture, already dried and weakened, but it does not heal, then know that nutrition is prohibited from reaching there; so immerse that part in hot water every time you take care of it; and do this for all three days; slightly relieve the tightness, and by this operation, direct the nutrition to the member, and thus cure it gradually.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But here is what foolish restorers of a member's fracture do when it does not heal according to plan, as it should, and instead worsens in its course, which is an error in their operation, causing great fear; if it were possible, they would enlarge the ancient wounds in the freed parts and turn them away from this.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And you have not seen any of them do this, so it is all the more reasonable that it should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	**Section: On Fractures When They Occur in the Head.**
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The fragments of fractures are diverse, and their shapes vary, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are caused by the impact of a blow that completely shatters the bone within its joint, leaving the bone thus shattered in the flesh, and the incision does not pass through the rear of it; and this type of fracture is called *levatio absoluta*.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the extent of these two types of fractures is either great or slight, and they can be caused by compression or traction; and their cause is a blow with force or an unexpected impact on the bone.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, causing the pannus (fatty tissue) to be close to the bone, or it is on the surface of the bone; and the severity of these two types of fractures can vary greatly.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And in fractures where the bone is shattered into small pieces within its joint, so minute as to affect only a few hairs, this type of fracture is called *capillary*.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And it is a fracture that is caused either by an accident or by the impact of a stone, and appears as if some layer of bone enters the cracks inside, and it occurs in the concavity of the place just as it happens with the bones of the leg when they are struck and their entry into the cracks inside.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And it is most commonly found in the bones of the humid body, just as it is in the skulls of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures, when the bones are separated like stars, are painful just as when stones are detached.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And then come to the remembrance of all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I would recognize all these types of fractures by detecting them, and by questioning their attempts, and the outward appearance of the corrupted flesh that is upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And a special capillary is known for being discovered over the bone, it is cleaned, and bandaged over it as the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fractures, one must consider from the beginning the accidents of illness, and if you observe signs that indicate by their manifestation on evil, such as vomiting of cholera, extension, loss of understanding, loss of voice, fainting, acute fever, bleeding from the nose and redness of those parts, and similar symptoms in the vital organs, it is not considered healthy.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you observe non-corrupt accidents, you hope for health, then you begin the treatment of them.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	Which cause is because if the plague comes to you at the beginning as it comes and this happens in the winter, then you should study the condition of the bone regarding its position on the twelfth day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is during the summer days, you must be careful to cut off the flesh surrounding the bone on the fifth day, as what remains will be corrupt with panicula, and accidents that we have mentioned may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the pannicula covering the brain and is in small pieces and inflammation, you must carefully incise the comminuted and inflamed part, as I have mentioned before.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	For it is that you cut open the patient's wound, discover the bone according to its usual position and manner, as possible based on the form of the plague, and then close over the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you encounter a bone fracture with pus or abscess, be cautious and treat it as follows: fill the area with soaked bandages in wine and rose oil, and let the plague rest until the abscess is calmed and be sure of the flow of pus; then begin with the circumferential incision around the bone and its removal.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the other method is that you insert the knife into the bone at an angle, and this is its form: Then administer another incision to this one, slightly wider than that one; and this is its form.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Then administer the wider incision than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	You should choose the right number of incisions, some wider than others; and some shorter, with their tips more acute, made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion over the incision to prevent any conflict between its head and the wound.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, you must pierce through its circumference before administering scissors to the incisions, which are called non-penetrating incisions.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus, but because they do not reach the end of the bone in the testis, so that when it is brought close, its rounded extreme or margin is over what remains of its head, sharp like a margin or small circle, which prevents it from being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a great number of these incisions, as each one suits the specificity of every bone, provided that in all parts of the skull, the end of which should be sharp, the quantity in length and brevity is according to the amount of specificity of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	This is the method of three kinds of incisions: The quality of perforating through the circumference of a broken bone is to place the incision over the bone and twist it in your hands, as long as you know that the bone is already penetrated; then change the incision to another location, and stop when you have completely gone around the thickness or width of the ray or region.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then cut with scissors what is between any two bones, and make that thin pus flow over it in a lifting manner, as we have said, to remove the bone, or with your hand, or with any other cause through some tools you prepare for this purpose, as well with pincers and forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And be careful that the scissors do not touch any cause of damage to the patient.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	So, once you have perforated the bone and it is separated from the tissue if it was connected to it, and you have extracted it, be careful that you scrape and clean it on the roughness of it from what is in the bone differently from the scissors, but nonetheless ensure it is both thorough and subtle compared to other scissors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if you encounter any fragment of small and thin bones, then use the facility at your disposal from among your tools; and then apply this to cure the wound with liniment and ointment as we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another method of operation is light, free from pain, which cuts Gaul and praise for great merit; and this is the speech of it: It is necessary for you at the beginning that you begin to uncover the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most violent and evident, until when you have uncovered that space and have paused, leaving behind the extremity of this slow and gentle cut, of which this is the shape.
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the lenticular partition is round and does not cut any cause, and the acute partition is in two parts ahead in length, so when you have it; the lenticular partition should be adjusted to the shape of the face of the acute-incising one on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	Then strike the cut of one partition with a small mallet until it cuts through the bone completely, thus revolving, and you should be sure of the pannicul that it does not occur in it by accident that you fear in any way, and if the physician14 was the most foolish among all men and the most ignorant of their; certainly, he would have been sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	When a rupture occurs in any part of the pancreas due to some cause related to bone, he should incise it with a scalpel at its edge, and then deliver the pancreas from it easily, as it is freed from its pain and suffering.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	If the bone fracture does not penetrate into the pancreas, and what has been severed from the bone is the face of it, containing asperities and subtle lines, then you must scrape off those asperities and eradicate those subtile lines with the razors you have prepared in various numbers, to be able to administer them in every location as most convenient for their use and most correct according to how your operation has left the broken bone and its shape.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And you must administer in your reasoning with which to scrape the bone at the beginning, using the subtlest of those razors, and do not cease doing so according to continuity until you have administered the most powerful and subtlest of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu. E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And this is the cause that it is not preserved for all those who have studied this art.

And the restoration of it is to lay the patient on their back, and place a cushion between their thighs; then press their muscles and adjust their ribs with the help of two assistants, and be delicate in the operation and disposition according to every possible manner that suits this case, so that the shape of the bone returns as it was.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then apply a plaster and stopgap using a thin sheet of sauze or calig (a type of cloth) and similar materials in layers, wrapping it around; be delicate in binding the broken bone without causing further damage; periodically check the binding and tighten it as the swelling goes down; consider the binding at all times, and when it becomes softened, tighten it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	If it becomes necessary to cause the displacement of the fragment, or if there is corrosion, pain, or an abscess at the site, then cut and remove the plaster, and clean the wound, rectifying what has occurred by means of treatment; reduce the new plaster if needed; and adjust the binding so that healing takes place.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of broken ribs.

Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of the fractured spine of the back and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes, the bones of the neck can fracture and their cartilage can be affected, resembling the fractures of the spine in the back.

And if it is necessary to remove the atrophy of a bone or any cause that has already separated from it, you must clean any discharge on the wound and expose the bone; then adjust the two edges of the wound, suturing them if they are large; and tend to the healing of any incarnated pus from infections, as long as it heals.

Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the broken assistant (or: support).
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjutori is what lies between the thigh and the head of the shoulder.

If infection through cauterization occurs, then leave the tightness within the seventh day, place a cloth soaked in vinegar and rosin on it while the abscess is healing, and then tighten it again.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the method of tightening it is to place a plaster over the fracture, then wrap new cloth around the plaster; adjust the arm onto the aid, and keep your hand open over its muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And unroll the cloth and tighten it around the arm aid to keep the arm in place without any hindrance from the broken bone.

And it is that it rests on the fracture that is both thick and strong compared to the other bones; and it places between each bone the width of the finger, and the length of the bones according to the break with an addition of three parts from the whole.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then tighten the bones with the bandage or splint that I mentioned at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that the bandage or splint over the fracture should be tighter.

And then consider the dressing on all parts for three days so as to prevent any occurrence of pressure or swelling at the site; and also ensure that food does not reach the member due to excess tightness of the dressing; and therefore correct everything as we have said.

Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	As for the custom of the assistant and the leg support, they should be tightened for 10 days, and you will notice that they become loose and should be given baths and applied with ointments that correct it.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is old and healed, you will not loosen that ligament and stitches within one day or within two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of arm fractures.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones, which are called the humerus and the radius; of these, one is smaller, which is known as the elbow bone, and the other is larger, which is supported below the small bone, extending upward.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And if the main or secondary bowstring is broken, it is usually broken in two pieces at once.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the smaller bowstring breaks above, its restoration is easier, and its healing is faster.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the bowstring below breaks, and its fracture is severe, then healing becomes difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And even worse is when two bones break at the same time.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that breaks is the smaller bowstring above, it is good for the doctor, as its restoration requires less effort and time before it heals completely.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	But if the larger bowstring breaks, then more extension is required, which is more difficult.

E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And be sure to place your hand in such a way that you restore the intestine and extend it over one of the cushions, with the wrist of your hand away from them, more so than all the others, and the painful area lower than the rest, with the patient resting on a prepared bed.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And place a cushion in front of them at the appropriate height or angle, so that the patient does not struggle.

E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	Then the doctor should align the bones within to reduce them, according to the best possible configuration.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the treatment of the bone there are obstacles, then you must perforate and reduce all the weight to its place with your skill.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears to be a separated fragment that will not respond to treatment and restoration is not hoped for, then you must cut it off and stop it according to the method we have discussed above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	If the fracture is severe and you have already dealt with this particular case in a previous chapter, then take up the care of that one as well.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort. E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And allow the member to relax until it rests, then carefully return the constriction.

And what is right should not be overlooked in these proximal fractures, which rarely occur, especially to those who have little knowledge or experience with this my book; for that fracture speaks to you in the greatest dispositions for a direct and strict healing.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	But in the case of a man's broken leg, take a poultice from above and place it on the leg; then wrap it with cloth, and wrap it again, and lay it for three days or so, and it will heal.
Capitol .xix.	Capital XIX.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of broken bones when they are injured.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for him who suffers a fracture due to an injury, especially if the bone is large, such as the bone of the thigh or its counterpart, or similar to that which requires incision and drainage as we have said above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the injury causes pus, then you should incise it, holding back the discharge as you cover it with a clean cloth or bandage three times, unless there is another reason not to do so.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And soon after, begin to restore the fracture in that member, and do not prolong it, unless there is a risk of gangrene.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	If an abscess occurs cauterize it carefully, then leave the healing of it within the ninth day, until the abscess has subsided, and do not approach it on the third day and the eighth of every month, lest you cause further harm.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	If a bone is broken and protruding from the skin, cover it to prevent further damage and use your hands or tools to gently reduce the fracture and align it with minimal extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	If the extension is beyond your control and the alignment of the bone requires a specific tool, then use your hands or a suitable instrument; an ideal instrument for this purpose is one made of metal, with a length of seven or eight digits, and its width should be determined by the amount of damage; for this reason, a doctor must have several of these tools of varying lengths and widths for different types of fractures.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And once reduced, it should be secured with minimal pressure to prevent further displacement during the operation.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should be of sharp extreme on which the margin of its extremes; and the upper part of it should tend to thickness, and from the middle part of it within the divisions.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is the form of it:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is called "voluntary lip opening" in Greek, hence the term "paleta pauca".
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	For the purpose that the acute end of it is stopped above the prominent bone's extremity.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And it draws back all at once as the bone returns, and is wrapped around with some tension.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And therefore it tries to intertwine the ends of the fracture between them, and if the broken end is thin and does not take the instrument for good leverage, then you must insert the end of that bone within the instrument's reach.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	If you cannot return the bone to its original position, cut off that part which we have mentioned for him with scissors or saw it in any way possible to your skill.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then cut off that which is rough on the bone with small chips.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is returned, and the hernia is reduced, if the patient feels intense pain, know that the bone has not returned to its natural position; then do what you have found beneficial for the patient.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When your restoration to the bone is complete, then immerse a piece of black sticky fabric in vinegar, and especially if it's summer, do not place any seal or other material over the wound, so that it does not suffer putrefaction and corruption.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then apply straw in the right manner for the complete restoration of the bone, leaving the wound exposed so that you can cut through it with scissors and use bandages according to the size of the wound.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And be extremely careful not to strain the wound towards the fracture, as you have seen foolish doctors do this, and they cause their patients great pain or even death from corruption or severe injury, which is unwise.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the contraction of the wound is slight, flexible, different from the contraction of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the wound is large or a bad wound, and you are concerned about further complications such as those we have mentioned, and you feel pain in that area, do not apply pressure to it, but rather use a hard cloth wrap instead of straw and tighten it around those parts.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when, after one or two days, the pain begins to manifest, having been engendered in the joint, you should remove from its position the cloth that you had placed over it, and then administer certain remedies, those which by our custom are used to treat such plagues, just as we use tetracycline and similar substances.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	And it is fitting for you to clean the wound and consider the plague each day and night until it is consolidated and healed, and ensure that the member is prepared in such a way that the pus can flow from it easily.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the plague passes many days and is not consolidated nor does the pus leave the joint, then you should know that here are only remedies for the pain in order to prevent the plague from spreading.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And of those remedies, some are separated and removed, those that are not separated and cause the member to swell and produce pain, pierce you to incise them according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if the wound is infected with pus or ulceration, which is a sign of corruption and putrefaction, you must clean each one of them as is appropriate for their cure, which is preceded by a description in its chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o xxx; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And regarding what I must say and you present your case: when the flesh is torn, it protrudes over the member, as if the bone of the thigh and its support are broken and resemble those of the larger members, and do not attempt to attract or extract it, for such actions may cause death; after leaving that open for a few days, perhaps 2 or 3, then treat the wound if you have observed it, and if not, leave it.
Capitol .xx.	**Chapter XX.**
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the cure of nodules that occur at the site of any fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Motas seen during this process occur in the aftermath of a fracture, particularly near joints, and are characterized by the shape of the member; thus, they greatly hinder the member's normal function.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider whether the nodule is recent and administer those medicines that have been found effective for such cases, namely, aloes, senna, and similar herbs; if you take some or all of these, and they prove to be astringent, or contain albumen from urine, or are sour in nature, then apply them topically to the nodule in a compress, and constrict those around it with good compression.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And check for any restriction that does not release it every few days; then loosen that and apply another, as long as the nodule persists; or fasten a lead sheet over the area, since lead has the property of drawing out any swelling in the members.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If it is already decided that the stone has become hardened and narrowed due to necessity, then divide it by the most superior part of the stone, cut off the superfluous and prominent parts, or quickly extract it until it is completely removed; and treat it as it heals.
Capitol .xxi.	**Capitol XX1.**
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	Regarding the restoration of a broken bone, once restored, then the delicate member should be bandaged properly according to its nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a bone fracture is healed, then the delicate member should be secured properly, not by any arbitrary means: one of which is for the solution of the ligament and the binding of the affected part according to what is needed; or due to an excessive tightness of the ligaments that prevents proper nutrition from reaching the member; or because of excessive swelling; or due to inappropriate movement at the wrong time; or because of a pus pocket in the patient's body and through the weakness of the member.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu.	The treatment for this is to restrict food to the patient and make their body take in the swelling until the pus is multiplied; and administer baths; and carefully press and massage it.
E aprop pausa pegua sobre le membre, per so que la pegua atire a lu mot nutriment, o continua embrocacio de lu am aygua tebeza, entro que·l nutriment corr e retorne a la sua figura natural.	And then apply pressure over the member, so that the pressure draws appropriate nutrients to it, or continue washing with warm water until the nutrition flows and returns to its natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter .xxii.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the treatment of broken bones that are distorted, their operation should be prohibited from what it covers.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an incident occurs in the already restored member, then the healing of it from distortion and bending of the broken bone should be sought, and this is done by reshaping the member, however, the member is not prohibited from its natural operation; nevertheless, one must heed the advice of those who consider that member to be newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	There have indeed been many foolish doctors and healers on our land who have performed this operation, and such an act is most reproachable, causing great fear at the sign of which it is mortal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the claudication and bending are recent, then they should be treated with tepid water containing herbs that soften them, such as alder bark and other similar ones; and a compress should be applied with this, or made from thick mucilage of alder bark, or mixed with hen's egg or olive oil, and applied to it; or the use of fig leaves, wrapped in cloth, like those used in certain medications called 'amermans' (soothing agents) for consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And sometimes it is dissolved by constant gentle friction against the moistest parts, and movement of the affected member should be given at regular intervals throughout the day.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the deformity has already progressed and becomes severe, requiring surgical intervention, then it is necessary to drain the pus that has formed and ensure the continuity of the bone structure is maintained. This involves incising what is superfluous in terms of pressure from that part of the bone using subtle saws, and providing relief from strain and stress in that area through careful management.
Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De sermo en dislocacio.	**On the topic of dislocation**
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is the displacement of one of the joints from its normal position, resulting in a loss of mobility and distortion of the body's shape, causing severe pain and significant injury to the affected area.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when you encounter some dislocation, it should be reduced as soon as possible, and not delayed, for if it is delayed, the location becomes inflamed and the reduction of the dislocation becomes difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And also, do not think it is worse or stretched during the inflammation, because spasms and severe pain occur as a result.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When this happens, be aware that you must perform a flabotomy on the patient, and place something between their thighs to prevent further dislocation, and then immerse the affected member in warm water and oil, and reduce it gently.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And all members should be treated with the aforementioned water and oil, so that their memory returns to its proper place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And you have already arranged the chapters of dislocation as mentioned above, in the case of fracture; from the departure of the upper body to the lower part of the body.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter .xxiiii.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of mandible dislocation.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	If both jaws are dislocated, without any fracture; then the dislocation of both is caused by one of two methods: either they are slightly moved from their places with a little pressure, and they become soft for a moment; or they are completely dislocated and swollen, so much so that saliva from the injury cannot flow out, and neither can he close his mouth nor hold his tongue.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When the dislocation is slight, it often returns to its original position on its own with a little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	If the dislocation is complete and severe, it is necessary to gently reduce the jaw to its place, without delay.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the physician must have his hand on the patient's head, and the doctor inserts one finger of his hand into the root of the jaw dislocation inside the patient's mouth, if the dislocation is from one side; or he inserts both fingers together, if the dislocation is from two sides, and all the other fingers are outside them, which he equalizes; and he commands the patient to cease moving his jaws and release those that come from each separation; and the physician does the same with the jaw until it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially when both jaws are simultaneously dislocated, then apply evaporation with water and oil until a light reduction of both is achieved without delaying the reduction of either. As we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And so when they return and are aligned, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not relaxed, then place those powders from a bandage on cerot, and make it with wax and softened oil; and then gently lift them to facilitate the ligaments.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And the patient should sleep on their back with their head between two pillows, so that they do not wince to the right or left, and do not force any cause for pain; having their food well chewed, then when the pains are relieved and the jaws are loosened, they will wince where they wish.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And to this, facilitate rest should be given, and do not work on the perception of the mouth during eating, drinking, and excretion, as long as the jaw is loosened and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce the jaws when they are dislocated at any time and not returned to their proper places, then fevers and persistent vomiting occur, and a strong feeling of pain is felt in the patient's belly, and often they vomit pure cholera.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, you will know it is a loss, and often those to whom this happens die within a few days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter .xxv.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of a dislocated furcula (a bone in the elbow) and the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The furcula is not dislocated from the latissimus dorsi (a muscle in the back) by following its continuation towards the leg; however, sometimes it moves to a position outside its normal location, and this is described as dislocation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration is that the patient remains on their back and extends their arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then compress the area with your palm firmly, so it returns.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then apply pressure to that compress and poultice, and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	Place the end of the affected limb next to the joint, so it is not dislocated on any day; then cover and secure it as we have said and according to your equipment.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	Then apply bandages, poultices, and compression, and command the patient to remain in tranquility and rest until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	In this medical procedure, the cure involves reducing the end of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter XXVI.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On reducing the displacement of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You should know that the muscle is not dislocated in any ordinary sense, but it can be according to three manners: one of which is its displacement at the attachment from below.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the first is that it is dislocated at the origin of the muscle, and this is done with difficulty; it is not dislocated in the back parts through the shoulder; and it is not dislocated in the front parts by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.
